meanings.definition: The act, process, or state of floating.
meanings.sent1: The floatation of the boat was smooth and steady on the calm lake.
meanings.sent2: The floatation of the balloon allowed it to rise into the sky effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The floatation of the rubber duckies in the bathtub made bath time more fun.
meanings.sent4: Her floatation in the pool of happiness lifted her spirits high.
meanings.sent5: The floatation of the feather on the water's surface was mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: The ability or tendency to float.
meanings.sent1: The toy's floatation in the pool made it easy to retrieve when it fell in.
meanings.sent2: The life jacket's floatation kept the swimmer safe in the deep water.
meanings.sent3: The floatation of the ice cube in the glass kept the drink cold.
meanings.sent4: His floatation in the ocean of uncertainty gave him hope for the future.
meanings.sent5: The floatation of the leaf on the stream showcased nature's balance and beauty.

meanings.definition: The process of offering a company's shares for sale on the stock market for the first time.
meanings.sent1: The floatation of the tech company's shares was highly anticipated by investors.
meanings.sent2: The successful floatation of the startup's shares brought in significant capital.
meanings.sent3: The floatation of the new company's shares caused a buzz in the financial world.
meanings.sent4: Her floatation of the business shares marked a new chapter in her career.
meanings.sent5: The floatation of the shares opened up exciting opportunities for the company.
